title: Catholic clergy abuse report could prompt lawsuits, changes to Illinois law
description: Illinois’ attorney general ended a five-year investigation into sexual abuse of children by Catholic clergy in the state Tuesday, releasing a nearly 700-page report that revealed the problem was far worse than the church had said in 2018 at the start o...

title: Texas mall shooting suspect's alleged extremism part of growing trend in US: DHS
description: Senior DHS officials said he had a "neo-Nazi ideology."

title: AM or not AM? Carmakers mull the future of radio
description: ABC News' Jason Nathanson spoke to "Start Here" about the controversy over Ford's decision to remove AM radio and its change of plans after pushback.

title: Biden to call for end of gun violence 'epidemic' a year after Uvalde shooting
description: President Joe Biden plans on Wednesday to call on Republicans in Congress to act to end the "epidemic" of gun violence in the United States, the White House said.

title: Las Vegas resort housekeeper accused of stealing over $700K in jewelry from room
description: A housekeeper at a Las Vegas resort is accused of stealing more than $700,000 worth of jewelry from hotel guests, police said.

title: Legendary singer Tina Turner dies at 83
description: Singer Tina Turner, known for her sultry voice, has died. She was 83.

title: Rapper Fetty Wap sentenced to 6 years in prison for drug trafficking
description: Prosecutors said the 31-year-old hip-hop star, whose real name is Willie Junior Maxwell II, was a kilogram-level redistributor for a drug trafficking organization.

title: Salmonella outbreak linked to raw cookie dough sickens 18 across 6 states
description: A salmonella outbreak has sickened 18 people across six states. The outbreak has been linked to Papa Murphy's raw chocolate chip cookie dough and s'mores bars dough.

title: Judge denies bond for ex-Alabama basketball player Darius Miles on capital murder charge
description: A judge has denied bond for former Alabama basketball player Darius Miles, who is facing a capital murder charge related to a fatal shooting near campus

title: Yellowstone baby bison put to death after visitor picks it up, leading herd to reject it
description: Yellowstone National Park officials say they had to kill a newborn bison because its herd wouldn’t take the animal back after a man picked it up

title: Haley commits to federal abortion ban but says it's unlikely without more Republicans in Congress
description: The presidential candidate didn't say how many weeks a ban should encompass.

title: Kenneth Anger, influential avant-garde filmmaker and author, dies at 96
description: Kenneth Anger, the shocking and influential avant-garde artist who defied sexual and religious taboos in such short films as “Scorpio Rising” and “Fireworks” and dished the most lurid movie star gossip in his underground bestseller “Hollywood Babylon,”...

title: McCarthy sends GOP negotiators to White House 8 days before potential default
description: He said they would "try to finish out negotiations" as June 1 deadline looms.

title: Virgin Orbit to cease operations, sell assets of Richard Branson's satellite launcher
description: Virgin Orbit will cease operations and sell its assets to four winning bidders, the company announced late Tuesday

title: South Carolina 6-week abortion ban heads to governor's desk for approval
description: The South Carolina Senate passed a six-week abortion ban. It now heads to Gov. Henry McMaster's desk for approval, where it is expected to become law.

title: Alex Murdaugh indicted on federal fraud charges
description: A federal grand jury has returned a 22-count indictment against Alex Murdaugh for fraud charges.

title: Police: Student fatally shot by another student outside Pittsburgh school
description: Authorities say a student shot and killed another student outside a school in Pittsburgh shortly before classes were due to start

title: Prosecutors in Guyana mull charges for teen suspect in deadly blaze at girl's dorm
description: Police in Guyana are conferring with prosecutors on what charges to bring against the main teenage suspect in this week’s fire that destroyed a girl’s dormitory at a school

title: US announces $524 million in new aid for Horn of Africa drought, climate crisis
description: The United States has announced $524 million in additional humanitarian aid for the Horn of Africa that aims to put a spotlight on the extreme effects of climate change and the worst drought in the region in 40 years

title: WATCH:  Squirrel surprises fans at Yankees game
description: Video of a squirrel that ran across a railing in front of fans at a Yankees game has gone viral.

title: China defends ban on US chipmaker Micron, accuses Washington of 'economic coercion'
description: The Chinese government has defended its ban on products from U.S. memory chipmaker Micron Technology Inc. in some computer systems after Washington expressed concern

title: Australian police officer faces charges for shocking 95-year-old woman with stun gun
description: Officials say an Australian police officer will face charges for shocking a 95-year-old woman with a stun gun and leaving her with critical head injuries as she approached him using a walker and carrying a steak knife in a nursing home

title: Killer whales learn 'coordinated' attacks on sailboats, some observers say
description: Orcas may be teaching other to attack boats following a spate of attacks on sailboats off the coast of Europe, some observers say.

title: German prosecutor says clues to McCann child disappearance possible at dam site
description: Police searching for clues regarding the disappearance of Madeleine McCann, the British child who went missing in 2007 in Portugal, are concentrating operations in several areas around a dam including one where media reports say a lead suspect in the c...

title: Woman dies from injuries after being struck by police escort for UK royal
description: The Duchess of Edinburgh has expressed her condolences after the death of an 81-year-old woman who was hit by a motorcycle that was part of the U.K. royal's police escort

title: Russia says it shot down drones in border region after raid from Ukraine territory
description: A Russian official says Moscow's forces have shot down “a large number” of drones in Russia’s southern Belgorod region

title: Judge to rule if parents can speak on Nashville school shooting case in court
description: A judge will rule on whether to allow parents of kids killed in the Covenant School shooting to voice their opposition in court to the release of the shooter's writings.

title: Texas lawmakers set new standards to ban books from schools for sexual content
description: Texas would set new standards and ratings for sexually explicit material in order to ban books from public and charter school libraries, under a bill given final passage by the state Senate late Tuesday night and sent to Republican Gov. Greg Abbott

title: WATCH:  Ash plume from Mexico’s Popocatépetl volcano seen from plane
description: The ash plume from Mexico's Popocatépetl volcano was visible to passengers aboard a flight from Mexico City to Bogotá on Sunday.

title: NYC college professor fired after confrontation with abortion opponents
description: A New York City college has fired an adjunct professor who was recorded on video berating abortion opponents on campus earlier this month and who later reportedly threatened a journalist with a machete

title: Ex-Seattle man gets 8 years for stealing $1M in pandemic benefits
description: A former Seattle man who stole over $1 million in jobless benefits and small business loans during the COVID-19 pandemic has been sentenced to more than eight years in prison

title: Texas sues Biden administration over asylum rule, saying phone app encourages illegal immigration
description: The state of Texas is suing the Biden administration to have a newly introduced asylum rule thrown out

title: Typhoon Mawar set to hit Guam as potentially 'catastrophic' storm
description: Super Typhoon Mawar could directly hit Guam with winds as strong as 160 mph. It is expected to strike around noon local time Wednesday.

title: Concern about Mexico's Popocatepetl volcano changes with the wind
description: As Mexico’s Popocatepetl volcano continued puffing gas, water vapor and ash into the air, authorities recommended those downwind of its exhalations wear masks and cover their eyes

title: Protesters cut short questioning of San Francisco mayor over drug crisis
description: Protesters cut short a rare outdoor meeting of the San Francisco Board of Supervisors Tuesday where the board president had planned to question Mayor London Breed over the city's drug crisis

title: South Korean supplier plans $40 million auto parts plant in Georgia near new Hyundai complex
description: A South Korean company will build a $40 million factory to make heating and cooling systems near a Hyundai Motor Group auto assembly plant in coastal Georgia

title: How verified accounts helped make fake images of a Pentagon explosion go viral
description: Verified accounts on Twitter may have contributed to the viral spread of a false claim that an explosion was unfolding at the Pentagon on Monday.
